rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
SNMP is an application-layer protocol that provides a message format for communication between SNMP managers and agents. SNMP provides a standardized framework and a common language used for the monitoring and management of devices in a network.
 
1. This Runbook will display SNMP information in detail 
2. Displaying SNMP group version
3. Displaying SNMP community and its related ACL information
4. Displaying SNMP Traps information
 
References:
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/12_2/configfun/configuration/guide/ffun_c/fcf014.html"},"insert":"SNMP Information"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
SNMP is an application-layer protocol that provides a message format for communication between SNMP managers and agents. SNMP provides a standardized framework and a common language used for the monitoring and management of devices in a network.
 
1. This Runbook will display SNMP information in detail 
2. Displaying SNMP group version
3. Displaying SNMP community and its related ACL information
4. Displaying SNMP Traps information
 
References:
SNMP Information

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Monitor device SNMP status, it includes input packets and output packets.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) SNMP Table
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Monitor device SNMP status, it includes input packets and output packets.

Output:
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) SNMP Table

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Highlight device when device enable SNMP, and highlight device and draw device note about SNMP group when SNMP is enable.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) SNMP Security Model

		Draw notes on device level:
			1) SNMP Group
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Highlight device when device enable SNMP, and highlight device and draw device note about SNMP group when SNMP is enable.

Output:
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) SNMP Security Model

		Draw notes on device level:
			1) SNMP Group

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Highlight device when a ACL apply to change SNMP community, and a device note will be display in map about community information .

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Input:"},{"insert":"
The string of SNMP community "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(for example: private, public)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Safe Community String "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(color: green)"},{"insert":"
			2) Unsafe Community String "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(color: red)"},{"insert":"

		Alert items on device level:
			1) SNMP Community too Simple "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(condition: if input SNMP community has been found)"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Highlight device when a ACL apply to change SNMP community, and a device note will be display in map about community information .

Input:
The string of SNMP community (for example: private, public)

Output:
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Safe Community String (color: green)
			2) Unsafe Community String (color: red)

		Alert items on device level:
			1) SNMP Community too Simple (condition: if input SNMP community has been found)

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Highlight device when SNMP traps enable and SNMP traps related information will be displayed in device note.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) SNMP Traps Device
	
		Draw notes on device level:
			1) SNMP Traps Host
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Highlight device when SNMP traps enable and SNMP traps related information will be displayed in device note.
